channel.title: About the Lessons | Survey Research Methods

item.title: Getting Familiar with the Course
item.description:
• Data Camp

Data Camp

The purpose of these modules is not have you become a programmer! Rather these lay a foundation for a common language and software we’ll be using. Some are better than others and some are more technical than others as well. Just remember, this is not a programming class! Falling behind on these can make some material we cover in the course inaccessible. If you get stuck, please ask me for help, search the Internet or move on!

If you are feeling ambitious, please go ahead and start the first module covering the basics of R on Data Camp. There is a lot on there and please refer to the syllabus for the grading policy regarding those tasks.

item.title: An Introduction to Surveys
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Evaluation

Data Camp1

The first module covers the basics of R and its structure. Please complete the following modules.

Exploration Due by Required Course or Project Name Chapters covered
1 8/30/20 Introduction to R Intro to basics
Vectors
Matrices
Factors
Data Frames
Lists

As noted last week, there is a lot on there but please refer to the syllabus for the grading policy regarding those tasks. Just remember, this is not a programming class! Please ask questions!

Evaluation

Download a slideshow both in PowerPoint or PDF formats to learn about or review foundational concepts in evaluation.

  1. Accessible at Data Camp.↩︎

item.title: Covering the Population and Selecting Who to Survey
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Sampling

Data Camp1

The second exploration in R is a skill track consisting of four modules and covers a basic introduction to using the tidyverse family of packages in R. Please complete the following modules.

Exploration Due by Required Course or Project Name Chapters covered
2 9/13/20 Introduction to the Tidyverse Data wrangling
Data visualization
Grouping and summarizing
Types of visualizations
Working with Data in the Tidyverse Explore your data
Tame your data
Tidy your data
Transform your data
Dr. Semmelweis and the Discovery of Handwashing
Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse Introduction to Modeling
Modeling with Basic Regression
Modeling with Multiple Regression
Model Assessment and Selection

Please get started asap. There is a lot to cover!

Sampling

Download a slideshow both in PowerPoint or PDF formats to review different sampling techniques.

  1. Accessible at Data Camp.↩︎

item.title: The Fundamentals of Writing Questions
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Survey Design

Data Camp1

The third exploration in R called is a skill track Statistician with R consisting of fourteen modules covering modeling and statistical analysis. However you are only required to go through the ones listed below.

Exploration Due by Required Course or Project Name Chapters covered
3 10/18/20 Introduction to Data in R Language of data
Study types and cautionary tales
Sampling strategies and experimental design
Case Study
Exploratory Data Analysis in R Exploring Categorical Data
Exploring Numerical Data
Numerical Summaries
Case study
Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse Introduction to Modeling
Modeling with Basic Regression
Modeling with Multiple Regression
Modeling Assessment and Selection
Dealing with Missing Data in R Why care about missing data?
Wrangling and tidying up missing values
Testing missing relationships
Connecting the dots (Imputation)

Survey Design

Download2 a slideshow both in PowerPoint3 or PDF4 formats to review different item constructions.

  1. Accessible at Data Camp.↩︎

  2. These files are pretty big and are hosted on WVU’s Google Drive. You will have to login with your WVU MIX account to access them.↩︎

  3. With my voice. Listen I’m no Morgan Freeman.↩︎

  4. Without audio.↩︎
